original: Freudenthal, Heinz, kapellmästare, Norrköping, f. 25/4/06 i Danzig av rabbinen Max F. o. Eil’se Lichtv^itz. G. 27 m. pianisten Elsbet Hippéli. Barn: Otto f. 34, Peter 38. — Elev v. konserv. i Würzburg, statsex. 27. Kon-sertmäst. (altvioHn) v. Gbgs ork:-fören. 28-36, dirig. f. Norrköp. ork :-fören. o. radioork.
translated: Freudenthal, Heinz, conductor, Norrköping, born on April 25, 1906 in Danzig to the rabbi Max F. and Eil’se Lichtv^itz. Married in 1927 to the pianist Elsbet Hippéli. Children: Otto born in 1934 and Peter born in 1938. He was a student at the conservatory in Würzburg and passed the state exam in 1927. He was the concertmaster (viola) of the Gothenburg orchestral association from 1928-1936. He was also the conductor for the Norrköping orchestral association and radio orchestra.

structured.name: Heinz Freudenthal
structured.description: Heinz Freudenthal was a Swedish conductor and concertmaster (viola). He was born on April 25, 1906, in Danzig to the rabbi Max F. and Eil’se Lichtv^itz. He married pianist Elsbet Hippéli in 1927, and they had two children, Otto (born in 1934) and Peter (born in 1938). He attended Würzburg Conservatory and passed the state exam in 1927. He was the concertmaster (viola) of the Gothenburg Orchestral Association from 1928-1936 and also served as conductor for the Norrköping Orchestral Association and Radio Orchestra.
